title: Firefox Sync: Unidirectional sync possible (git push/fetch paradigm)?
content:
Hi all,

Fully aware of [https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1204859], I wonder if there is any way to force a synchronization from one specific browser to others? My scenario is as follows: I use a desktop computer for daily work. This computer is bascially the source of truth. I use literally thousands of tabs, organized w/ Sideberry and multi-accounts containers (~100) (2 profiles in parallel).

From time to time, I use a laptop when commuting or working elsewhere. I'd love to instruct the laptop to receive the latest update (like a git fetch), probably after telling the main computer to "upload" (git push) the latest information and would like to make sure the laptop never can overwrite the desktop information.

Is there any way to implement such a scenario?

Thanks!

title: Multi-Account Containers (FF v. 133.0 (64-bit))
content:
Restarted my PC and on boot found all my containers deleted. Bookmarks are fine. Browser settings are fine. Other Extensions and Addons are fine. Tabs from the last session were stll there. Everything else is all good. FireFox Multi-Account Containers is the only thing that's gone wrong.

Looking at my containers.json (my best guess on what to check) they're all back to default. There's no "Old Firefox Data" folder on the desktop.

This happens ~3 times a year usually after an update or if there's a sudden shutdown due to power loss.

I've used FireFox Sync before and rather than helping, it ruined everything for no apparent reason. It duplicated the current containers, restored and duplicated old deleted containers and sites stopped using their designated containers.

It sucks. It really really sucks.

Is there a way to make local backups of containers and their designations? Just knowing exactly what to backup would be a massive help and make this a lot less distressing.

title: Personalizações e configurações resetam a cada atualização
content:
Olá,

Toda vez que é lançada uma nova versão do Firefox meu navegador se atualiza e reseta minhas configurações de aparência (aquelas de quando clica com o botão direito na parte superior e escolhe "personalizar barra de ferramentas..."), reseta customizações feitas no about:config (por exemplo: costumo deixa browser.uidensity em 1, ele reseta para o default) e também reseta configurações das minhas extensões (exemplo: uso foxy gestures com gestos customizados e ele reseta tudo).

Além disso, assim que ele faz o update eu não consigo acessar site algum, fica carregando indefinidamente aquela página de novidades da versão. Então eu vou em ajuda>modo de solução de problemas>reiniciar, não faço nada, apenas abro em modo de segurança e fecho ele de novo para sair do modo de segurança e ele volta a acessar os sites normalmente.

Não alterei nada recentemente, todas as modificações e extensões são as mesmas que uso a mais de ano. Não lembro exatamente em qual versão isso começou a acontecer, mas é recente, no máximo de 2 meses para cá, e apenas quando há atualização da versão do navegador. Obrigado.

title: HTTPS unsecure connection message with self-signed certificates
content:
Hello,

We are manufacturers of networking devices.

As most networking devices, ours can be configured by navigating to the default gateway IP address via the browser. With the rise of security awareness, various regulations are forbidding the usage of HTTP. This is bothersome to us, as connecting to our devices via HTTPS and our self-signed sertificates will always throw an error of an unsecure connection to the end user. We understand the technical reasoning for this and that users are able to ignore the message, but this does impact our user experience and it may even discourage users from using our devices.

As these regulations will be impacting networking devices globally, we want to ask you if there are any workarounds for the self-signed sertificate "unsecure connection" message. Perhaps there is an argument that can be set, or an ongoing effort from browser vendors to assist networking device manufacturers with this.

Any information or help is appreciated.

Thank you.
creator: tobias.peukert92
